thread.title: BRIEF-GE Renewable Energy Signs Agreement To Supply Turbines For Wind Farms In Brazil

title: BRIEF-GE Renewable Energy Signs Agreement To Supply Turbines For Wind Farms In Brazil
text:
14 PM / in 20 minutes BRIEF-GE Renewable Energy Signs Agreement To Supply Turbines For Wind Farms In Brazil Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
Feb 5 (Reuters) - GE Renewable Energy: 
* GE RENEWABLE ENERGY SAYS SIGNED AGREEMENT WITH ENGIE TO SUPPLY 144 OF ITS 2.5-116 TURBINES FOR UMBURANAS WIND FARM COMPLEX IN UPSTATE BAHIA, BRAZIL 
* GE RENEWABLE ENERGY SAYS WILL PROVIDE 10 YEARS OF OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE AT THE UMBURANAS WIND FARM‍​ 
* GE RENEWABLE ENERGY SAYS THE 360MW WIND INSTALLMENT WILL ADD TO THE 326.7MW UNDER COMMISSIONING BY GE RENEWABLE ENERGY AT THE CAMPO LARGO I WIND FARM 
* GE RENEWABLE ENERGY SAYS THE NEWLY ANNOUNCED 360MW UMBURANAS PROJECT HAS BEGUN CONSTRUCTION; FIRST TURBINES SET TO BE DELIVERED IN 2018 
* GE RENEWABLE ENERGY SAYS THE 326.7 MW CAMPO LARGO 1 SITE IS CURRENTLY UNDER CONSTRUCTION & WILL BEGIN COMMERCIAL OPERATIONS IN JAN 2019‍​ Source text : [ bit.ly/2EITWGi ] Further company coverage:
